author: felixweber
title: LATAM Town Hall by Catalyst Swarm
description: Latin America does not have an adequate and frictionless entry point to the Cardano and Catalyst Communities

title: Cardano Ambassadors & Latin America
description: We need skilled and experienced Community Members which are able to provide guidance and mentorships when onboarding Latin America

author: jaitnez
title: New d-EdTech Platform for LatAm
description: Millions of people in LatAm are affected by low standards and unequal distribution of education, and the precariousness of the job industry.

author: alexp7
title: DALE
description: LATAM is a complex ecosystem of 33 countries and 660M people. We need to foster collaboration to help onboard LATAM people to CARDANO

author: arancibiapablo
title: Meetup Northeast Argentina 2022
description: There was never an event about Blockchain or Cardano in the Northeast region of Argentina.

author: spiralway
title: Nourish LATAM: Spirulina & Cardano
description: Malnutrition in LATAM is in it's worst levels, COVID-19 threatens food availability and economic access to quality food.

author: danbonfil
title: Latam Community DID Research
description: SSI/DID are hardly know in LATAM, let alone their benefits. If there is no community empowerment or sense of belonging; adoption wont follow

author: phuffyking
title: Newcomer Resources en Español
description: Cardano Education, News & Resources for NEWCOMERS is scarce in any language - & esp. Spanish! Need to provide good info for everyday people.

author: sessionizill
title: Decentralized Music Platform LatAm
description: Latin American artists only access to a global music marketplace is streaming giants like Spotify.  They need more favorable options.

author: thiago.mikail
title: CardAgro - a Marketplace for Agro
description: With over 20 million people living at hungry conditions, Brazil is at the same time a top agriculture producer (most without bank).

author: individuodigital1
title: Documental Vamos a cambiar el Mundo
description: Estamos transformando el mundo y el mundo no se está dando cuenta. Gran parte del trabajo de la comunidad es aun invisible para los demás .

author: enzagaray
title: NFT MARKETPLACE LATIN AMERICA
description: Registering in an nftstore requires validating the account and for that you have to send ada and pay a fee

author: vilela
title: Cardano Training & Complex Networks
description: Brazil is a nation in Latin America, and our students, professionals, and entrepreneurs are still unaware of the Cardano Blockchain Network.

author: gilvania
title: Cardano for STEM Brazilian students
description: There is a lack of courses about blockchain technology in Brazilian Universities, leaving our students out of the technological advances.

author: donna.vanderloo
title: Token issuance, backed by land
description: 16% of soils has a lifespan <100 years, losing carbon,water, nutrients[1]. Farmers want to regenerate, but exploit under financial pressure.

author: gathere
title: Grow the avocado producer
description: Lack of information and adequate technologies keep producers from reaching their financial potential and production capabilities

author: nftdao
title: Decentralized Content Distribution
description: Content creators in the LATAM region have difficulties distributing and monetizing their content.

author: matifalcone
title: ALDEA NFT - Community Marketplace

author: fhilip.k
title: Spanish/Portuguese Voter Survey-AIM
description: Latin-America-specific information about voters is not well understood, more focus is needed to ensure global engagement of Catalyst voters.

author: heikki.ruhanen
title: DID market study & deployment
description: Lack of understanding in DID solutions and validity of credentials in Latin America.

author: chianca
title: Portuguese onboarding Video Series
description: Across Brazil, English is not routinely spoken and portuguese is the language.  Language barriers reduce participation in Catalyst.

author: jmfotegui
title: Gig Economy Marketplace LatAm
description: LatAm faces a predominance of informal jobs. Around 50% of workers and 70% of recent jobs in LatAm countries are in informal conditions.

author: thenoetherprotocol
title: NOETH: Cardano for science in LATAM
description: Most PC users spend an average of 20% of their CPUs processing power. This is a strategic resource for scientists in developing countries.

author: alexp7
title: Token Allies, Latam Businesses
description: In LatinAmerica, It is very hard for businesses and start ups to get quick and easy access to funding, impeding many great ideas to be real.

author: chianca
title: The Catalyst School | LATAM
description: In LATAM, there's a language barrier for local communities to get educated about Catalyst since English is not commonly spoken in the region

author: gustapug
title: Decentralized Education - dTeach
description: Teachers are not supported to be actively involved in their professional development; students don't have access to an innovative curriculum

author: gustapug
title: STEM TERRITORY – Online Courses
description: Brazilian public schools don't have STEM education programs and students don't have support to actively engage in STEM projects.

author: matifalcone
title: Grow ALDEA, Grow Latin America
description: Despite having created a community to drive Cardano adoption in Latin America, massive growth and outreach is still very hard to accomplish

title: 🔰 dVote - LATAM 🔰 AtalaPRISM

title: Influencers as Ambassadors Brazil

title: Milkomeda documentation (es & pt)

title: Milkomeda Latam Hackathon

title: Lovelace translation Portuguese
description:
The language barrier should be lowered with solutions that bring content in many languages.
We would like to translate our video content

title: Cardano Totem: Onboarding the World
description: Users living in under-developed areas stand to benefit from Cardano the most. Yet lack the infrastructure to use this new technology.

title: Sustainable LatinAmerican Use cases
description: There should be more of a spotlight on stories of Cardano projects implemented in Latin America, their regional challenges & solutions.

title: Clean water, raise awareness.
description: Clean water comes in 20 liters bottles, not from the "potable" water, because of the hardness and the crypto is viewed like a Ponzi scheme.

title: Cardano Dev Português Brazil

title: Technical school for Latin America

title: SOIL: Regional education
description: E-Commerce is still developing in many regions of Latin America

title: Test DAO at Latam Public Spaces
description: LATAM adoption of Cardano evolves slowly given the weak awareness and insufficient tangibility of its uses for average citizens.

title: Real Estate Dao
description: In Latin America, it is very hard to access real estate projects either due to bureaucratic or financial problems.

title: Building a relevant community

title: Peace Blockchain Study, Colombia
description: The usefulness of the Blockchain for the peace process in Colombia is not known.

author: matiaswepfer
title: Latin American artists
description: The difficulty of the art community to tokenize their work.

title: Living Waters Costa Rica
description: There is a lack of exposure of the Cardano ecosystem and its benefits in the Latin American Community

title: Latam Women Cardano Plutus Bootcamp
description: It is a challenge to bring more diversity to web3 and Cardano developers communities. In Latam, we see too few women present in circles

author: joseiadicicco
title: Platform for Cardano Solar Farms
description: San Juan is one of the poorest areas of Argentina LATAM, with highest sun exposure, lack of water and energy lead to poor living conditions.

author: seedstars
title: Democratising Blockchain in Latam
description: Blockchain is a niche world reserved for those who have expertise. This leaves a gap for potential talent to jump-in and collaborate

title: Blockchain Latam Ecosystem Mapping

description: Growing Cardano's business-opportunities within Latin America's industry requires regional understanding and highly competent of local teams

title: Support small farmers in LATAM
description: Small farmers in LATAM face many challenges such lack of education and low productivity to financial exclusion and poor access to markets.

description: Growing the Cardano ecosystem and Cardano opportunities in Latin America's industry requires localized presentation- and training material

author: wolfram.blockchain.labs
title: Cardano Community Development
description: Cardano is underrepresented in Latin American communities and requires educational material and community hubs to engage/onboard new users.

author: chrobilliard
title: Endorsing the marginalized
description: The current financial system doesn't know how to trust the underserved. High default rates, and no trust in legacy institutions.

author: jrv97
title: Networking/Education LATAM
description: Awareness of Cardano's projects and vision is low in South America as a whole, but nearly non-existent among investors in Paraguay & Ecuador

title: DeFi School - Latin America
description: Lack of knowledge of DeFi is an impediment for Latin Americans to invest in this market, on the other hand, the crypto adoption is growing.

description:
The language barrier should be lowered with solutions that bring content in many languages.

title: cardway.finance - A payment gateway
description: For merchants from developing countries it is not practical to accept ADA as a means of payment. Therefore, restricting mass adoption.

author: doudrop
title: Demystify Blockchain in LATAM
description: LATAM financial regulators have been misguided by negative stigmas around crypto, causing them to associate blockchain with high risk.

author: linconvidal
title: CardanoRio 2022: Hybrid event
description: In Brazil, there is a lack of blockchain events (especially Cardano), which has been further intensified during the COVID-19 pandemic.

author: linconvidal
title: Introductory Blockchain MOOC PT-BR
description: Lack of PT-BR courses explaining what blockchain aims to solve from a historical perspective, pointing out Cardano as a potential solution

author: gabrielaxel
title: Pathform LATAM: Custom growth paths
description: Wellbeing is treated as a ($) lifestyle not applied to solving practical or global issues, much less in LATAM. This can be easily addressed.

title: Win-Win Expansion in Latam
description: Legal tech platforms such as Win-Win need to do some research to localize their products according to other countries' laws and culture.

author: ciro.gelvez
title: Food produced with Agriculture 4.0
description: Traditional agriculture doesn't have access to real-time data of crop conditions that would increase yield and give value to final product.
